website_summaries.verdict: The best cordless circular saw on the market, and the top value as well.
pros: Superb cordless that closely matches its corded rivals
cons: Small blade design meant for DIY'ers and not professionals

customer_reviews.title: works good.
customer_reviews.text: got tired of running extension cords for my skill saw. so figured it was time to add another dewalt 20 volt tool to my inventory. didn't notice till after i purchased it was a 6.5" saw but still does the job. And blades are about 25-30% cheaper for the 6.5" then the 7 1/4". Used to cut 2x4's, osb and sawed 2x6's and cut them all without a issue. Would recommend not leaving battery in unit. Safety switch works but would be easy to accidently hit safety switch and on switch while carrying it. so i always carry unit without battery and put battery in when i use it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great kit, but buy a big battery in addition
customer_reviews.text: Excellent kit. Batteries are underpowered for anything but the normal drill. They operate the equipment fine but you are only going to get a about 15-20 cuts on a 2x4 with the regular battery. With two batteries you may be okay if your not cutting a lot fast but I built a shed and wished I would have bought a 5 or 6 amp hour battery earlier. I spent the first two days spending most of my time trying to figure out what I could do while batteries were charging then prime came through with the big battery and I was pretty solid the rest of the project.
customer_reviews.author: APRoush

customer_reviews.title: Great little saw
customer_reviews.text: I’m really glad I bought this. It has plenty of power and is easy to handle. It cuts through 2x lumber with ease, using the included blade. The first day I got it I slapped one of the batteries from my driver on it and started cutting some 1/2 OSB. I did about 10, 8-foot rip cuts before the battery started to fade. Since then I bought a bigger battery and I haven’t reached for my corded circular saw since. I would definitely recommend using the larger 5 ah batteries. It works just fine with the smaller ones, but it will burn through them relatively quick.
customer_reviews.author: MJL

customer_reviews.title: Never looking back
customer_reviews.text: I wasn’t sure what to expect from this little saw. I was somewhat concerned about the oddball blade size, but I picked this thing up for a mere $99. Luckily I got the 5ah max batteries the same day as this was delivered. I don’t know about how long they would last on a job site, but I can get a whole day of cutting plywood and making shelves out of 1 battery! I’ll never go back to a corded circular saw!! This ain’t your daddy’s cordless tool!
customer_reviews.author: jvn bonedaddy

customer_reviews.title: I tried 'em all. . .and this one feels better.
customer_reviews.text: Milwaukee, DeWalt, Black and Decker, Porter Cable, Bosch. They all work fine! But, this one is ergonomically superior: It feels like it belongs in your hand.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Needs a guide for precision work
customer_reviews.text: This isn't my favorite cordless saw. I recommend buying a track guide and measuring the distance from the foot's edge to the blade to properly set up your cuts. I had an issue with the guide mark on this saw. It was hard to keep the mark centered on my line as I cut. The build quality is solid, but I would not recommend this saw due to the frustration of the guide mark.
customer_reviews.author: Adam G Binley

customer_reviews.title: update on rating.
customer_reviews.text: I am updating my first review that I wrote in frustration. We did have issues with receiving this item, but once that was straightened out, it arrived in good shape and works well. I am giving the seller the benefit of the doubt with the Covid19 lockdowns being the cause the delivery problems. So far have used it on PT 2x4s and plywood and are pleased with the performance.
customer_reviews.author: G. Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Saw works great for minor jobs
customer_reviews.text: Saw works great for minor jobs. Nice for inconvenient work areas. It definitely struggles with bigger cuts. My only complaint is that the battery really drains quick. More of a battery thing than tool but still need to be mindful that it only works for maybe half a doZen cuts before it's power diminishes
customer_reviews.author: Brad C

customer_reviews.title: and glad I did
customer_reviews.text: Handy and powerful. Wanted a cordless for those times when corded is inconvenient or feels unsafe due to space. Invested in a more powerful battery after reading other comments, and glad I did. Works smoothly and very handy to have in the shop. My other circular is a Festool with track, but with the cords can be difficult to use all over the shop due to various projects strung out across the shop floor. Can also take this anywhere, even to the store when I might need to cut something down to get it into the car. Invested in a better blade for smoother cut and am totally happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: cityToCountry

customer_reviews.title: Why did I wait so long to get one of these?
customer_reviews.text: I never really thought about how convenient this would be. Throw it in the truck to cut 20' rebar down to manageable size (obviously not with the included blade), working on a fence more than 100 ft. from the house, or any time you just have a couple of quick cuts to make are all good uses for this saw. Don't try to frame a house with it, but with enough batteries, you probably could.
customer_reviews.author: King Bee

customer_reviews.title: A REAL RIGHT-HANDED CIRCULAR SAW
customer_reviews.text: A REAL RIGHT-HANDED CIRCULAR SAW I have had so-called right-handed circular saws but the motor is on the LH side of the blade so you can't see the cut due to its blocked view. FINALLY I have a cordless circular saw with the motor on the RIGHT HAND SIDE. Add the name DEWALT to it and you really can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: jburton1963

customer_reviews.title: Impressive quality
customer_reviews.text: Dewalt has become my go to tool choice for home use. I upgraded from Ryobibthat was fine. But the Dewalt tools are much better in quality. The first activation of this Hand saw defined my explination just listening to it run. Not tinny at all. Of coarse cordless for me is the only option as the battery charge lasts a long time. I recammend all dewalt products.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT! You will not regret it I can guarantee that
customer_reviews.text: I was really on the fence about buying this, and how I was going to tell my wife i spend another 100$ on a tool. its one of those things you dont realize you cant live without until you use it,this saw is badass, of course it could be improved ( the sighting on the cut could be better). But you can not beat the power, great little saw would buy again in an instant.
customer_reviews.author: Summer

customer_reviews.title: Size does not matter with this tool.
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with another fine power tool from Dewalt. Was skeptical about this when I purchased it online due to the smaller size. A 6.5” blade is used with this circular saw. Used it right away and was impressed with the quality and power this saw had to offer. Size doesn’t matter here. Great product. Impressive performance.
customer_reviews.author: Public Name (required)

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: I bought into the 20 volt system and got this because I use a circular saw a lot. My mistake was not checking the size as this is a bit smaller than my 7 inch corded. The other thing I don't like is the safety mechanism you have to push in order for the trigger to work. It is not easy to push it making it awkward to start.
customer_reviews.author: just another brick in the wall

customer_reviews.title: nice when combined with other DeWalt tools
customer_reviews.text: Mine doesn't get much use. A building contractor will have better advice regarding durability, etc. Still I like the power and convenience of this unit. I have other DeWalt tools that use the same batteries, so together they are greater than the sum of the individual tools. It took a very long time to find a bargain price on this, but it was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: swell

customer_reviews.title: great battery life
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly quick and powerful. great battery life. I was surprised it is so good because it is not brushless (like milwaukee) and dewalt is a bit behind by not going brushless in this or their reciprocating saw. I chose to go dewalt because of their all metal transmission in their brushless drill as that is what i will use the most and now i have the drill, impact driver, light, circular saw, recrip saw, oscellating tool, weedeater and blower. Couldn't be happier with my decision.
customer_reviews.author: mkzynski

customer_reviews.title: All I Expected
customer_reviews.text: I can't speak to what others found lacking in their saw. Mine was fresh and new, and came with the blade and allen wrench. It is well made and all I expected. I did note that the price for a refurb was the same as new at both Amazon and CPO. Wonder if some others inadverdently ordered or got a refurb?
customer_reviews.author: Robert Slone

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: wow is all I can say. I was reluctant for many years to buy a cordless circular saw, I thought they would have no guts. I was wrong. I just made a full-depth cut through wet, green pressure treated 4x4 and it was indistinguishable from my corded Makita. This is my 4th Dewalt 20V Max tool, and all of them are nothing short of impressive.
customer_reviews.author: htp

customer_reviews.title: MUCH IMPROVED OVER PREVIOUS MODEL
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy and impressed with this saw as opposed to the previous 18 volt model. I remember being very happy with the 18 volt model, but as many of we users experience battery issues are expensive. This saw is even more ergonomic and functions very well while being comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie D

customer_reviews.title: Don't last! Save your money!
customer_reviews.text: Barely used this thing and the motor went out, sent it to the dewalt service center and they wanted $69.99 to fix it. Still looks like new. Only has a 1 year warranty. Save your money and buy a milwaukee!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: This is a great saw
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent saw. I use it to cut 2x4s and plywood mostly. Does everything I need. The only negative I could say is that it doesn't come with a battery. For the price you could get a larger and stronger corded saw but the convenience of being cordless more than makes up for that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Light weight and powerful. Easy adjustments for depth and angle, guide plate is solid and easy to see/guide your cut. Noise level is low compared to my worm drive but still use hearing protection. About the only addition that would be great is a laser pointer, but love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like it, very convenient.
customer_reviews.text: I was helping our contractor build a platform in the attic which required cutting many 2x4's and ripping 1/2 ply. He was using the cordless saw. It made all the cuts on one battery, nice... Its an impressive workhorse. I wonder how the bigger saw performs?
customer_reviews.author: Coffee, lunch and crab

customer_reviews.title: Solid DIY saw.
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up a bit back and use it periodically. Today I busted it out to cut some 2x8s. Sliced through like butter. I’m super happy with the power it offers. Definitely buy a nicer blade, but otherwise very please. Will update if longevity is an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Wright

customer_reviews.title: Made for work
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace my 5 1/2" corded Skilsaw which died after a mere 15 years. I loved that saw, but it had a good life. The Dewalt is better. More power, slightly heavier and no cord. No cord! The 5 amphour batteries are the way to go. I had to JB weld a mounting block for a rafter hook to my Skilsaw, and will probably do the same for the Dewalt, unless the awesome team behind this tool comes out with a rafter hook very soon. You cannot go wrong with this tool. I look forward to replacing all of my field tools with Dewalts 20 volt cordless tools.
customer_reviews.author: carpenter

customer_reviews.title: I’m surprised about the power !!!
customer_reviews.text: I have an old 11 amp skill saw This little saw is more powerful than my old one. I’m so happy that I purchased this little saw. It’s so nice not having a cord I’m a DIY-ER so in opted for the smaller saw And I’m not disappointed. If I would be doing a greater amount of cutting i would own more than one
customer_reviews.author: Mike Hundertmark

customer_reviews.title: DeWalt
customer_reviews.text: Hard spots in wood need a bit of gentle patience. Can RIP through the soft parts like butter. Eats batteries, fast. You'll need multiple batteries. I use it to make shims for door installs, and get about 12 shims from a 5ah battery. I also use it to cut 2x4 to support girts. Beats the cr*p out of the Milwaukee saw.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this saw as a stand alone. It was a great deal and is very light and easy to use. I was very happy that saw wasn’t damaged because the box was beat! It’s insane that delivery people don’t treat these items more carefully.
customer_reviews.author: Sparky

customer_reviews.title: Excellent saw
customer_reviews.text: What a handy saw! I was able to cut boards down to size for a deck with no need for drop cords. This little saw is even able to handle ripping a 2x8x12 in half, and never lost power. I recommend the extended batteries for it too. They are defiantly worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Sheltonator

customer_reviews.title: Very Light weight and easy to use in the field one handed.
customer_reviews.text: Building a fence, needed to be able to cut, quick and accurate on the fly, without having to lug out the corded beast or take lumber to the chop saw. The battery won't stay charged forever but the light weight and cutting power make up the difference. Great for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: M. Twain

customer_reviews.title: Light weight, cordless and seems powerful
customer_reviews.text: I haven't cut much with this yet. But the things I have cut, this does a great job. The part I like the most is not having to drag out an extension cord with it or to cord getting stuck in the middle of a cut. The weight is great too, much lighter than the standard worm drive corded saws.
customer_reviews.author: Fordaholic

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I never used a cordless circular saw. I just do small projects around the house and for family. Today I finally used this it’s winter I needed to cut some 2x4s and just walked outside and cut em easy. I loved that I didn’t need to run a extension cord thru the snow. It was so convenient!!
customer_reviews.author: Willow307

customer_reviews.title: Really Love 20V Li-Ion Dewalt Tools
customer_reviews.text: I've recently upgraded to the 20v Dewalt tools, my goodness the difference between the old 18v tools is amazing. They are lighter, more powerful, and every bit as durable. This 20v Li-Ion circular saw is perfectly sized, portable, powerful, and Li-lon batteries last longer and charge faster. Dewalt 20 V tools are fantastic !! My all time favorite: the 20V Oscillating Multi Tool. A true "top of the line" battery powered Tool !! Wow ! PS to Dewalt: your Christmas sale of $25 off any $100+ tool was a customer bargain and brilliant marketing move!
customer_reviews.author: theflipguy

customer_reviews.title: Very nice saw
customer_reviews.text: First things first, This is a BATTERY powered saw. It just can't compare directly with a 15 amp plugin saw. The battery version has a "Max Power Output" of 460 Watts, while the plugin is about 1800 Watts max. That being said it is a great battery powered saw. The whole Dewalt 20V system is great. The saw has a very narrow blade which means small kerf, it is light weight and works well on 2" or 1" lumber. I have not tried it on 4x4's, I would likely go get a corded saw. I highly recommend the 3 or 4 amp hour battery for this one. The smaller batteries just won't last long.
customer_reviews.author: TIN

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband while he was building our pole building. It has made life so much easier not having to worry about extension cords. I already had a drill and impact driver with an extra battery so we just put this one into the rotation. Love this saw!
customer_reviews.author: Heather Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these saws for work and they work flawlessly. I would recommend anyone buy these that is looking for a great value and a precise cutting saw. The seller shipped the saws fast and without any damage to the items. These saws cut exactly how you want them to and are easy to clean up. They look really nice and are not extremely heavy when I need to move them from place to place. This is a definite great buy and I highly would recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Randy mujica

customer_reviews.title: Good for the amount of use I’ll need and use it
customer_reviews.text: Overall I liked it, however; the plastic guard isn’t quite as heavy duty as I would like. If I planned on using it more I would spend the extra money and get the next option up
customer_reviews.author: TryinItTwice

customer_reviews.title: highly recommend,  it just runs and excellent selection great quality great price and value
customer_reviews.text: Extremely handy extremely powerful we use it all the time glad we ended it to our tool selection seems like all the guys grab for that first another great product from DeWalt
customer_reviews.author: Joel R Manesberg

customer_reviews.title: Do you love woodworking as a hobbiest
customer_reviews.text: Do you love woodworking as a hobbiest? GET THIS! It's so light compared to the BLACK & DECKER corded saw that I had, so much that I ignore the B&D saw when planning for a project. Don't be fooled by it's size, it's pretty powerful and like any cordless device, as soon as you let off the trigger it stops dead in its tracks, so no more cut toes or fingers even when the blade guard is stock wide open.
customer_reviews.author: Ali Al-Mohaishi

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Stopped using my full-sized, corded circular saw due to the hassle. This thing is nice and light, no cord and is perfect for most of the tinkering I do.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: No battery included
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't use this for over a year. Would have been nice to know that it didn't come with a battery. But came with a blade that wasn't to come with it. Poor advertising for this product.
customer_reviews.author: RepairMan

customer_reviews.title: Great saw! Just have a 4.0ah battery, or higher...
customer_reviews.text: Have used this once just last week on multiple deck boards and 2x4's. Went right through them. I had a spare battery from my impact Dewalt to use with this (as it does not come with a battery, as stated). Battery is still going strong as I have the 4.0Ah which I highly recommend if you want to use it without always charging your battery, or buying 2.
customer_reviews.author: S.B.

customer_reviews.title: Sounds like a good idea but the blade just won't tighten and binds up during cuts...
customer_reviews.text: Used twice, the second time two weeks after the "1 month" period for returns and support... the blade jams up and won't tighten in to place. I'd like to return it if I can. I love my DeWalt tools but this must be a dud.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Cuts like butter
customer_reviews.text: This saw is so much better than my previous generic brand from the blue store. Used it to repair my fence and I couldn't be happier. Adjustment is easy and firmly locks into place. The safety engaged much easier and in a more natural way. The support grip is a softer rubber which is actually comfortable to hold. You can't go wrong with DeWalt.
customer_reviews.author: Jake B

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw
customer_reviews.text: I love this saw just like I love all my DeWalt tools. It works great has plenty of power and let’s face it, I’m just too damn old and weak to lift my Skil saw like I used to in my 30s and 40s
customer_reviews.author: Lori Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Nice saw
customer_reviews.text: I love cutting 2x4's without having to deal with cords, and this saw works awesome for that. I also like the blade on the left side for us right handers to see what we are cutting. Works plenty good for the homeowner on hobby work, but for commercial framing, I'd stick with 15 amp worm drive saw.
customer_reviews.author: Buckblaster

customer_reviews.title: My Go To saw now.
customer_reviews.text: Great saw when the blade is replaced by the Diablo D061X6-1/2 by 40 Finishing Blade. Cutting speed is not compromised with this finishing blade. Balance is good, cut depth adjustment is smooth and locks firmly. Blade guard get out of the way properly and does not hang up. The new higher capacity battery, though bigger and heavier, does not change handling. Now DeWalt needs to make a worm drive version, cordless.
customer_reviews.author: W. W.

customer_reviews.title: Ask my co-worker, Tom, I say it all ...
customer_reviews.text: Ask my co-worker, Tom, I say it all the time... "Best money Ive ever spent." Plus a year later I threw a Flexvolt battery at this thing and turned it into a monster. Stop what you're doing and buy this now!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool to have!
customer_reviews.text: It works as in the reviews. I bought this because of the high rating and was skeptical about it. But it works pretty well. Lightweight and easy to hold is huge plus. With a a large Amp battery, I was able to cut lots of 2x6's on my first Pergola project. I would recommend this circular saw the DIYourselfers.
customer_reviews.author: Jun

customer_reviews.title: Love the 20 Volt tools from Dewalt.
customer_reviews.text: This saw is great. I bought it as a bare tool because I have several other 20 Volt Tools with Batteries. It does the job. I am really surprised with the power it has. I have used it on a couple of home projects and could not see going back to my corded saw unless I had to cut really thick wood. It is compact and light weight and very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Chasjs

customer_reviews.title: No charger in the package.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the set with battery, and it doesn't come with charger for the battery. So now I have to spend another $40 for the charger. Haven't used the saw yet hope it will be good money spent!
customer_reviews.author: SHUANG LIANG

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw
customer_reviews.text: The saw works beautifully. I highly recommend for anyone looking for an awesome saw, and who already owns other Dewalt battery operated tools. I was using 5Ah batteries with the saw, as I don't think the smaller batteries can provide enough juice.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Good tools and worth it
customer_reviews.text: This is a great saw. I wish it was a tad smaller, but it is so light with that small, high-charge battery that I cannot complain. It will work for me for many years!
customer_reviews.author: Erstwhile

customer_reviews.title: Review of 6 1/2“ DeWalt 20 volt battery operated Circular Saw
customer_reviews.text: Rapid delivery of an exceptionally inexpensive DeWalt 6 1/2” 20 volt, battery powered Circular Saw. Very pleased
customer_reviews.author: Ivan A. Backerman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for cutting plywood scraps 5/8
customer_reviews.text: Cuts awesome. Way better than expected right through 5/8 plywood. Bought as a gift for my father in law.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie G.

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied with this product
customer_reviews.text: Easy to handle and to adjust. Ample power cutting 3/4" plywood. Way more power and cuts than I got from the older Nicad powered saw from Dewalt. Light weight even with 6 AH batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M.

customer_reviews.title: Great little saw
customer_reviews.text: Great little saw. Powerful enough to cut through actual 2” rough lumber. Handgrip is very comfortable. Bare tool is a real value.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Lavorgna

customer_reviews.title: Typical Dewalts quality
customer_reviews.text: If you are used to Dewalts quality, this will not disappoint. Light, plenty of power and uses the battery packs that I already have. Rock solid construction.
customer_reviews.author: T. Chu

customer_reviews.title: very good circular saw
customer_reviews.text: its a very good circular saw overall. Just needs a little bit more rpms. For the price its a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Rip Vyas

customer_reviews.title: Very handy tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for those small jobs. Saves time and effort over the larger corded saw. Blade is on the left so you can see the cut. Very powerful and easy to use. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice saw
customer_reviews.text: Works great nice to not have to worry about a cord and battery life last i use a 4 amh battery and always runs long time
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Given as gift
customer_reviews.text: I have the same saw in my shop and I love it. I bought this along with the drill and impact driver combo. That way he got the charger and two batteries as well.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Renfrow

customer_reviews.title: No cord
customer_reviews.text: Love the little saw, use it everywhere I am without A/C power and when I don't feel like running an extension cord.
customer_reviews.author: nana

customer_reviews.title: This saw has been a life saver
customer_reviews.text: Great saw with great features. Being able to have the built on wrench, easy blade lock,/depth lock/bevel lock, has made this saw a good buy. The power behind it and being wireless at the same time has made it a great buy. Tried out a bunch of other wireless saws and this by far outperforms all the ones I've tried.
customer_reviews.author: David & Laura DiPilato

customer_reviews.title: cant go wrong with the DWalt stuff
customer_reviews.text: opened package Installed the included saw blade cut wood at will nothing more to add! ........................ except I LOVE MY DEWALT STUFF!
customer_reviews.author: CETECH

customer_reviews.title: Love this saw
customer_reviews.text: Love this saw. It cuts through anything. Super nice cuts. And quite! Love all dewalt tools
customer_reviews.author: Rex B. Conaway

customer_reviews.title: Super simple and easy...
customer_reviews.text: Works great, but I definitely burns through the battery quite rapidly. I have three 20vt drill batteries and I am able to have one constantly charging. I would say that after about 30-45min of constant use on this saw you will need to switch out the batteries. Highly recommend purchasing spare batteries
customer_reviews.author: Chums322

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Great saw. As a woman I feel very comfortable using it and it’s just the right size. It’s not too heavy and cuts perfect. I’m happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ejas

customer_reviews.title: It works great. I have made several cuts on 2X6 material ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to do light work without having to string out an extension cord and use my big heavy Skill wormdrive. It works great. I have made several cuts on 2X6 material without running the battery down. I am using the really small battery from my DeWalt drill. If I was going to do a lot of work I would probably either use the wormdrive or get bigger batteries. All in all this saw works great.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L. Howeth

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift for hubs
customer_reviews.text: Got this for hubby as a gift after weeks of searching and trying to figure out what would be best, and turns out, I did good!! Works great, hubby loves it, price was unbeatable and I didnt even have to battle any hardware stores alone!!
customer_reviews.author: Kenzie

customer_reviews.title: Fight crime.
customer_reviews.text: Great for cutting boards to cover windows when you ha e thieves next door.
customer_reviews.author: luluschef

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Great saw works as advertised. Fast shipping, packaged well for transport. Highly recommend this seller.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M.

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight BUT cuts big!
customer_reviews.text: Love the cordless feature. Handy for a quick cut, no extension cords needed.
customer_reviews.author: Nanjolie

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Quality...
customer_reviews.text: Really a nice saw. Very handy, easy to use and so convenient!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: but expect it'll do great. It's smoother than my corded sidewinder
customer_reviews.text: Solid & very strong tool. Cuts PT 2x8 smoothly without slowing or binding. Crosscut & angles too. Haven't tried ripping yet, but expect it'll do great. It's smoother than my corded sidewinder. I actually prefer the dewalt over my corded. Battery lasts forever- lost count on number of 2x before recharge. Lasts the better part of the day
customer_reviews.author: Lars E. Helgeson

customer_reviews.title: It's like cheating
customer_reviews.text: Cordless, powerful, compact circular saw? Spend the money and get it.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Roy

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: Great saw. Works with the 20v batteries I have for my drill making usage easy. Strong, accurate cut too. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy S

customer_reviews.title: Good product

product_meta.description: Style:Circular sawThe DEWALT DCS391B 20V MAX 6-1/2" Circular Saw features a powerful 460 MWO, 5150 RPM motor that delivers power and speed to make the most demanding cuts with ease. A high strength and lightweight magnesium shoe provides jobsite durability for long-term cut accuracy, and an optimized rubber over-molded comfort grip delivers optimal balance and control. The 0 Degree-50 Degree bevel capacity allows for aggressive bevel cuts for a multitude of applications, along with the 6-1/2" carbide tipped blade for cutting 2x material at 90-Degree and 45-Degree and more cuts per charge. No load speed: 5150 rpm, Arbor size: 5/8", Depth of cut at 45-Degree: 1-5/8", Depth of cut at 90-Degree: 2-1/8". Includes: DCS391 6-1/2" Circular Saw, 6-1/2" Carbide-tipped Blade. This is a bare tool item (battery sold separately).
